meanings.definition: In a way that can be foreseen or expected.
meanings.sent1: The sun predictably rises every morning.
meanings.sent2: She predictably finishes her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat predictably meows for food at the same time every day.
meanings.sent4: His predictions were predictably accurate, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The train predictably arrives at the station at 8:00 AM sharp.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is consistent or reliable.
meanings.sent1: The clock predictably ticks every second.
meanings.sent2: He predictably wears the same blue shirt every Friday.
meanings.sent3: The joke predictably made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was predictably warm, like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The old car predictably sputters before starting on cold mornings.
